item.title: Playing Javascript with VisualStudio Code
item.description: Project Configuration SC-P open action menu, type javascript and choose “Go to project configuration” Create/Edit jsconfig.json at the workspace root ${workspaceFolder}/jsconfig.json by defaut it looks like { "compilerOptions": { "module": "commonjs", "target": "es2016", "jsx": "preserve" }, "exclude": [ "node_modules", "**/node_modules/*" ] } Debugging Click Debug icon in #Activity Bar# to activate the Debug view Click gear icon at the top of the Debug view to create/modify launch.json, which locates at ${workspaceFolder}/.

item.title: Accessing DOM from a Vue App
item.description: Although it is more preferable to use virtual-DOM for exchanging data between UI components and model in a Vue-based application, accessing DOM elements directly is still required in some special cases: using 3rd-party libraries (e.g. green-sock for animation) You can still use standard DOM access method var el = document.getElementById('el-name') Vue offers a convenient way to do this work <!-- any tags as well --> <div ref='myref' other-attributes > </div> new Vue({ //.
